Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PST11-RK (Synthetic AMPs, Tritrpticin analog, lys-rich, Trp-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, amino acid deletion, porcine cathelicidin, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 53.85% similar toTritrpticin. K: 36%, W: 27%, P=F: 18%.Activity: Active against E. coli KCTC 1682 (MIC 4 ug/ml), S. typhimurium KCTC 1926 (MIC 4 ug/ml),  B. subtilis KCTC 3068 (MIC 2 ug/ml), and S. aureus KCTC 1621 or 2 strains MRSA (MIC 2-8 ug/ml), 2 strains vancomycin-resistant E. faecium (MIC 8 ug/ml) anti-VRE. Non-standard assays in 50% LB.MOA: lysed more anionic liposomes than zwitterionic liposomes.In vitro toxicity: human RBC (4%): HC50 >200 uM, less hemo.lytic.
Literature Information.Author: Yang ST, Shin SY, Hahm KS, Kim JI. 2006
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Antimicrob Agents. 2006 Apr;27(4):325-30. doi: 10.1016/j.ijantimicag.2005.11.014.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Design of perfectly symmetric Trp-rich peptides with potent and broad-spectrum antimicrobial activities.
